page.title: 03WHITE HOUSE FARM
page.content: 180 acres of arable land, 17 acres of wood. Crops grown, wheat for chicken feed and bread, barley for animals feed and brewing.Peas go to Birds Eye. Beans are exported to Germany for sausages. The farm has a small chicken unit with 5,000 Hisex birds. The chickens come in at 20 weeks old, it takes three weeks till laying,they lay for 14 months. They eat 4 oz of food a day and produce a 2.5 oz egg a day. The value of arable land was Â£200 an acre, in 1985 it is worth Â£25,000 an acre.{GRANGE FARM} 155 acre mixed farm growing wheat, barley and grass for grazing and silage. 3500 chickens, 2000 Warrenders, 1500 Hisex reared for eggs. 5 chickens in each cage, fed on 18 tons rolled barley, 18 day lay for 14 weeks. Beef production, 55 Charolais X weighing 400 kg sent to market.
